alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 04 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Hempstead, Howard, Lafayette, Little River, Miller, Nevada and Sevier. Portions of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, McCurtain. Portions of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Bowie, Camp, Cass, Franklin, Marion, Morris, Red River, Titus, Upshur and Wood. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches, with local amounts to near 8 inches have already occurred, and an additional 3 to 5 inches of rainfall are possible through Thursday morning.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
